title: Nalli Ka Salan Recipe
description: Hyderbadi Nalli ka salan is a traditional dish prepared on special occasions. It is a spicy dish served with Rice and Roti. The Nalli pieces are cooked with spices and to thicken the gravy they add coconut paste which gives the texture to the gravy.
method: For dry powder- Dry red chilli, mace, Fennel Seeds, Cinnamon, Cardamom, Clove, Curry leaves and Dry Copra. Dry Roast and make it into a fine powder and lastly keep it aside,
Clean the Lamb Shanks and keep aside.
Take a pan, add oil and saute onion until golden brown then add ginger-garlic paste.
Add tomato puree. Add the dry roast powder, turmeric powder and stir well.
Add lamb Shanks then add hot water and bring it to boil.
Now, add curd and cook the shanks well.
Once shanks are cooked, take the shanks out of the gravy and keep aside.
Now strain the gravy finely. Then add back the shanks and cook for some time.
Place it in a bowl and garnish it with juliennes of ginger and chopped coriander.
key_ingredients: Dry Coconut/Copra, Dry Red Chillies, Mace, Fennel Seeds, Cinnamon Stick, Cloves, Green Cardamom, Curry Leaves, Big Sliced Onion, Tomato Puree, Cooking Oil, Ginger Garlic Paste, Curd

title: keema naan Recipe
description: This is a delicious naan recipe, stuffing is prepare with mince mutton & spices. Spicy stuffing makes this keema naan complete meal, you can pair this with raita or your favorite gravy.
Ingredients: 1/2 tsp coriander powder1/2 tsp cumin powder
method: In a bowl add maida, salt, sugar, some oil, curd and water to knead a soft dough. Pat with some oil and let this rest for around 2 hours.
In a pan heat some oil; add ginger garlic paste, minced meat and onions.
Cook for some time and then add the powdered spices like cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, haldi, red chilli powder and salt according to taste.
Once the keema is almost cooked, add coriander leaves and take off the heat.
Get the dough and section into 4. Make thick medium sized rotis and add the stuffing in them.
Pinch all sides together and roll with light hands.
To bake cook 50% on a pan and then add to a pre heated oven.
To cook in tawa, lightly flip on both sides until golden brown and cooked.
Brush with coriander and garlic butter and enjoy with a dip of your choice.
key_ingredients: Maida , salt , sugar , curd , neutral oil, Water as required , minced mutton , onions , ginger garlic paste , red chilli powder , haldi , cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, coriander leaves
